title: The Writer's Almanac - Wednesday, October 20, 2021
description: “Reading a poem silently instead of saying a poem is like the difference between staring at sheet music and actually humming or playing the music on an instrument." –Robert Pinsky (1940)
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: “Reading a poem silently instead of saying a poem is like the difference between staring at sheet music and actually humming or playing the music on an instrument." –Robert Pinsky (1940)
